abstract: HTC, a Taiwanese cellphone maker, received U.S. regulatory approval Monday for the first phone that uses Google’s Android software. The clearance paves the way for T-Mobile to offer the device during the holiday selling season.
snippet: HTC, a Taiwanese cellphone maker, received U.S. regulatory approval Monday for the first phone that uses Google’s Android software. The clearance paves the way for T-Mobile to offer the device during the holiday selling season.
lead_paragraph: Last week, we told you that Taiwan-based HTC, one of the largest mobile device makers in the world, was readying the first smart phone to use Google’s Android operating system.

headline.main: A ‘Dream’ Come True: U.S. Approves the First Google Phone
